isis.stitle: RADIATOR, REMOVE AND REPLACE - MXT - COMPONENT AND RADIATOR REMOVal - COOLING SYSTEM RADIATOR HOSE

svcproc.title: COOLING SYSTEM RADIATOR HOSE
svcproc.para: Worm-Style Clamps are used at both the radiator lower and upper connections, and can be removed with a flat-head screwdriver (Figures 17 and 18).

figure.caption: Figure 17. Lower Radiator Hose with Both Worm-Style Clamps Showing
Figure 18. Upper Radiator Hose with Both Worm-Style Clamps Showing

step1.para: Beginning with the lower radiator hose, locate the worm-style clamp (Figure 17).
Utilizing a standard flat-head screwdriver, remove the cooling system hose clamp, closest to the radiator.
At the upper radiator hose, locate the worm-style clamp closest to the radiator (Figure 18) and remove this hose clamp as in Step 2.

For both the lower and the upper radiator hoses: the entire hose/tube assembly connection does not have to be removed to remove the radiator. If the existing hose is to be replaced, remove worm-style clamps and replace hose.
Locate lower radiator tube at the engine end with worm-style clamp (Figure 19). Remove clamps if necessary to remove entire radiator hose and tube assembly.

figure.caption: Figure 19. Lower Radiator Tube at Opposite Side of Radiator End with Both Worm Style Clamps and Tube Support Showing
